New Records: Freddie Freeman is the second player to have multiple home runs and a triple over the first two games of a World Series.
Freddie Freeman's second player to have multiple home runs and a triple over the first two games of a World Series is a notable achievement, but no new record is explicitly stated.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani sustained a painful-looking shoulder injury while attempting to steal second base.
Yoshinobu Yamamoto retired 11 straight batters to finish his biggest start since arriving stateside.
Alex Vesia got out of a bases-loaded, ninth-inning jam in the World Series.
Yamamoto's final line: 6 1/3 innings, one hit, one earned run, two walks and four strikeouts.
Freddie Freeman hit a home run to put L.A. up 4-1.
Teoscar Hernández hit a home run off Carlos Rodón before Freddie Freeman followed by winning a six-pitch battle that ended with another homer.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers gave Yamamoto the biggest contract in the history of pitching to keep him away from the Yankees and Mets last offseason.
The Yankees have crushed a lot of spirits in the seventh, eighth, and ninth innings this postseason.
The Dodgers would certainly like it if Yamamoto can go longer than his usual, say, five innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts referred to the injury postgame as a 'little' subluxation.
He said the team will do more tests, but early signs were positive.
Dave Roberts is betting on his top bullpen arm, and it's going to be ugly if it goes against him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series heads to New York for Game 3, with the Yankees in as must-win of a situation as it can be without elimination on the line.
The Dodgers lead the World Series, 2 games to 0.
The Yankees' backs are now against the wall.
Their next win will be a must for them to stay in the series.
Others: The Dodgers' 2-0 series lead is the better place to be, even with one of the game's best players potentially injured.
Clarke Schmidt will be on the mound against Walker Buehler in Game 3 on Monday.
Ohtani's shoulder injury looms large for the Dodgers, but early signs are positive.
